summary.seg: The principal content of this manuscript, apparently copied in 1561, is a compilation of selections of Byzantine canon law. The copyist appears to have been the person responsible for assembling the compilation, a hieromonachos (monk and priest) named Theonas. A miscellaneous assortment of brief religious and secular texts and excerpts have been added to the blank leaves left at the end of the manuscript, probably by the same hand.

The manuscript opens with a dedication to the Metropolitan of Serres, suggesting that he may have been the work's patron, although the addition of the assorted texts at the end of the volume suggests that it remained in Theonas's possession. The dedication is followed by the opening of a prefatory text on the spiritual motivation of the work undertaken, which breaks off in mid-word after a few lines, followed by a note identifying Theonas himself. On the next page this text is repeated and continued to its conclusion, followed by the date and the name of Theonas in stylised monocondylion form. Since names in monocondylion were usually signatures, this is the principal indication that this man was responsible for both the copying and the content of the manuscript. Another brief prefatory text, again giving the date and Theonas's titles, follows on the next page. This sequence of content suggests that the introductory material was in the process of being drafted here. Combined with the informality of the script, this would suggest a working manuscript, perhaps intended as the basis for a subsequent fair copy, but the adornment of the main text with simple ornamental initials in red ink is more suggestive of an intention for long-term use.

The selections from the canons make up the majority of the manuscript. They are followed by a series of prayers, interspersed with multiple blank folios. In the last few folios appear some very brief texts of classical content, including poetry and brief aphorisms excerpted from a number of ancient authors. The unsystematic distribution and arrangement of these assorted texts suggests that they were added incidentally at various times subsequent to the copying of the main content, rather than forming part of a single plan.

msItem.author: Theonas, hieromonachos
msItem.title: Dedication to the Metropolitan of Serres
msItem.incipit: f. 1r Πανκυρώτατε ἡμῶν αὐθέντα καὶ δέσποτα τῆς ἁγιωτάτης μητρπόλεως, Σερρῶν
msItem.explicit: f. 1v εὐχαὶ ἔστωσα φυλακτήριον ἐν παντὶ βίω ἡμῶν, ἀμην

msItem.author: Theonas, hieromonachos
msItem.title: Prooimion
msItem.rubric: f. 2r Περὶ πῶς γράφη τὴν μαρτηρίαν ὁ πνευμάτικος τοῦ μελλοντος ἱερωθῆναι
msItem.incipit: f. 2r Οἱ τὰ θεῖα καλῶς διαταξάμενοι θεοκήρυκες ἀπόστολοι
msItem.explicit: f. 2r ἵνα μὴ τὰ θεῖα ἀνιέρως πράττον
msItem.colophon: f. 2r Θεωνᾶς ἱερομόναχος καὶ πνευματικὸς μαρτηρῶ τὸν ἄνωθεν Δεκεμβρίῳ (?) ἄξιον τοῦ ἱερωθῆναι καὶ χρόνου τελειοῦ

msItem.author: Theonas, hieromonachos
msItem.title: Prooimion
msItem.incipit: f. 2v Οἱ τὰ θεῖα καλῶς διαταξάμενοι θεοκήρυκες ἀπόστολοι
msItem.explicit: f. 3r καὶ μαρτηρῶ αὐτὸν εἰς δόξαν Πατρὸς καὶ Υἱοῦ καὶ Ἁγίου Πνεύματος, ἀμην.
msItem.colophon: f. 3r Ἐν ἔτει ͵ζοʹ μηνὶ Δεκεμβρίῳ (?). Θεωνας ιερομοναχος
msItem.note: This is a repetition and completion of the preceding text; the signature is given in monocondylion form.

msItem.author: Theonas, hieromonachos
msItem.title: Prooimion
msItem.incipit: f. 3v Θεῖα καὶ ἀρχιερατικὴ ἐπιτροπῆ τὰς τῶν ἀνθρώπων δεχόμενος
msItem.explicit: f. 3v ὅπως λάβη τὸ ἀξίωμα τῆς ἱεροσύνης
msItem.colophon: f. 3v εἰς ἰνδικτιῶνα δʹ ἐν ετει ͵ζοʹ μην (?) + Δεκεμβρίῳ (?) ἱερομόναχος καὶ πνευμάτικος
msItem.note: ff. 4r-6r are blank; f. 6v is blank apart from a later note.

msItem.title: Selections from the canons
msItem.rubric: f. 7r Δήλωσεις ἀκρίβης εκ τῶν κανονικῶν διατάξεῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 7r Ὁ δεχόμενος τοὺς λογισμοὺς τοῦ ἀνθρώπων ὀφείλει εἶναι τύπος
msItem.explicit: f. [86v] ἐπί τι μάθω χρόνον αʹ καὶ μετανοίας φʹ

msItem.title: Prayer on the harvest
msItem.incipit: f. [87r] Ὁ πάντα τελεσφορέσας τὸ λόγω σου Κύριε
msItem.explicit: f. [88v] καί σοι τὴν δόξαν ἀναπέμπομεν, τῶ Πατρὶ καὶ τῶ Υἱῶ, καὶ τῶ Ἁγίω Πνεύματι· νῦν καὶ ἀεὶ καὶ εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων, αμην
msItem.note: The heading is repeated in a variant form: ἡ εὐχη τὸν κολυβην

msItem.title: Fragment
msItem.note: Most of this folio has been torn away; only fragments of a few words survive.

msItem.title: Prayer for the succession to an ecclesiastical office
msItem.rubric: f. [115v] Εὐχὴ λεγομενη παρὰ ἀρχιερέως ἢ ἱερέως· ἢ πνευματικοῦ πατρὸς· εἰς τὸν μέλλωντα μεταλαβεῖν
msItem.incipit: f. [115v] Κύριε Ἰησοῦ Χριστὲ ὁ Θεὸς ἡμῶν, Υἱὲ καὶ Λόγε τοῦ Θεοῦ
msItem.explicit: f. [119v] σὺν τῶ ἀνάρχω σου Πατρὶ, καὶ τῶ Παναγίω καὶ ἀγαθῶ καὶ ζωοποιῶ σου Πνεύματι· νῦν καὶ ἀεὶ καὶ εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων ἀμην

msItem.title: Prayer for the blessing of wine
msItem.incipit: f. [124v] Κύριε ὁ Θεὸς ἡμῶν ἀγαθὲ καὶ φιλάνθρωπε
msItem.explicit: f. [125r] καί σοι τὴν δόξαν ἀναπέμπομεν, τῷ Πατρὶ, καὶ τῷ Υἱῷ, καὶ τῷ Ἁγίω Πνεύματι, νῦν καὶ ἀεὶ, καὶ εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας τῶν αἰώνων, ἀμήν

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.incipit: f. [127v] Ἱμερτὸν ὦ Ζεῦ τοῖς φιλοις πλέξαι στίχον
msItem.explicit: f. [127v] Σμῆνος τὲ κλεινὸς ἀπάσης Γαλατίας

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.explicit: f. [127v] τοῦ δεσπότου γὰρ ἐγγὺς η παρουσία

msItem.title: Sayings of the Seven Sages
msItem.explicit: f. [128r] Βίαντος Πριηνε Οἱ πλεῖστοι κακοί

msItem.author: Hesiod
msItem.title: Opera et dies
msItem.incipit: f. [128r] Οὐκ αἰεὶ θέρος ἐσσεῖται· ποιεῖσθε καλιὰς
msItem.note: This is the entire text of the excerpt

msItem.author: Plutarch
msItem.title: Conjugalia praecepta
msItem.note: Excerpt: ed. Stephanus, p. 141, section A, line 3-section B, line 2
msItem.incipit: f. [128v] Ὁ Ῥωμαῖος ὑπὸ τῶν φίλων νουθετούμενος
msItem.explicit: f. [129r] καὶ ἄλυπα καὶ προσφιλῆ παρέχειν

msItem.author: Isocrates
msItem.title: Ad Demonicum (oratio 1)
msItem.note: Excerpt: ed. Brémond and Mathieu, section 34, lines 1-2
msItem.incipit: f. [129r] Βουλευόμενος, παραδείγματα ποιοῦ τὰ παρεληλυθότα τῶν μελλόντων
msItem.note: This is the entire text of the excerpt

support.material: ff. 1-[93] Western paper, folded in sextidecimo (sixteens). Watermark: Anchor ( c. 70 c. 40 ) at the upper end of the fore-edge, similar to Mošin 1386. This example is dated to 1550-1570.

ff. [94-105] Western paper, folded in sextidecimo (sixteens). Watermark: Pilgrim ( c. 70 c. 40 ) at the upper end of the fore-edge, comparable but not identical to Briquet 7596. This example and variants is dated to 1580-1596.

ff. [106-114] Western paper, folded in sextidecimo (sixteens). Watermark: Pilgrim ( c. 50 c. 40 ) at the upper end of the fore-edge, comparable but not identical to WZIS DE5580-Codgraec278_7/12. This example is dated to 1551-1600.

ff. [115-119] Western paper, folded in sextidecimo (sixteens). Watermark: Pilgrim ( c. 55 c. 40 ) at the upper end of the fore-edge, somewhat comparable but not identical to Briquet 7595. This example is dated to 1572-1573.
ff. [120-129] Western paper, folded in sextidecimo (sixteens). Watermark: Pilgrim ( c. 55 c. 40 ) at the upper end of the fore-edge.

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript is foliated with the numbers 1-8, [9-129] in pencil, in Arabic numerals, recto, upper right.

collation.p: The manuscript consists of 18 quires, of which two were of twelve folios, one is a ternion, one is a binion and the rest are quaternia.

list.item: Quire 18-2 ff. 1-6 The first folio forms the left pastedown; the last folio has been cancelled or lost, apparently without loss of text.
Quire 138-1 ff. [87-93] The last folio has been lost, without loss of text
Quire 1512-3 ff. [106-114] The first, sixth and eleventh folios have been lost, without loss of text.
Quire 166-1 ff. [115-119] The first folio has been lost, without loss of text.
Quire 184-1 ff. [127-129] The last folio forms the right pastedown.

collation.signatures: There are signatures in Greek numerals on Quires 2-11, on the first folio of each quire, recto, upper right. They begin with the number 1 on Quire 2 (αʹ-ιʹ).

supportDesc.condition: Most of ff. [93] and [125] has been torn away. There is significant wear and creasing to the fore-edge. There are areas of dirt.

handNote.p: The manuscript was copied in an informal mixed minuscule script, slanting slightly to the right, in black ink, with modest variation in letter size.

Syllabic abbreviations and superscript word endings appear throughout the line. Breathings are round and mute iota is absent or subscript. There is decorative use of the double dot, and accentuation of all lengths of nomina sacra. Accents are sometimes joined to letters, breathings and nomina sacra strokes. The double grave accent is in use.
The modern eta, modern nu, sigma telikon and loop epsilon are present.
Punctuation used includes the middle and upper points, lower and middle commas and full stop.
Some headings are written in the same style in red ink.

decoDesc.decoNote: Many sections begin with simple minor initials, sometimes slightly ornamented, in red ink.
A minority of sections begin with minor initials in black ink.

additions.p: A note on the left pastedown reads ἀρχὴ σὴν Θεῶ ἁγίω ὦν αλήλουγιριον . There are occasional pen-trials. On the right pastedown are notes including a copy of the monocondylion of the hieromonachos Theonas from f. 3r and a cryptographic substitution sequence.

On f. 6v a later hand has copied the heading on f. 7r opposite, with a Latin description: Δήλωσις ἀκριβὴς εκ τῶν κανονικῶν διαταξίων. Liber chartaceus. The same hand has added occasional annotations in Greek and Latin (e.g. ff. [32r-35r]).
Notes on the left pastedown give the present classmark and the former classmarks Δ.3.16 and K.3.16 (altered from K.3.17).

A note on the left pastedown records the manuscript's donation to the College by Samuel Ward in 1643: Liber Collegii Dominae Franciscae Sidney Sussex ovem (una cum aliis MSS Plurimum Reverendi vir Samuel Ward S.T.D. Professor pro Domina Margareta dicti Collegii tertius Magister, ultima voluntate et testamento legavit. Anno Domini 1643.

binding.p: 17th-century full leather binding, with plain pastedowns. There is decorative blind tooling on both boards and the spine. A leather label added to the spine bears decorative gold tooling and the description Liber chartaceus MS, tooled in gold; the classmark appears on labels.

history.origin: The manuscript was copied by the hieromonachos Theonas Theonas, hieromonachos and completed in December 1561, as indicated by the colophons on ff. 2r, 3r and 3v. The dedication to the Metropolitan of Serres on f. 1r-1v suggests that he could have been the patron.
history.acquisition: Bequeathed to Sidnex Sussex in 1643 by the theologian Samuel Ward (1572-1643) Ward, Samuel, 1572-1643 , Master of the College.

availability.p: Visitors to Sidney Sussex College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Sidney Sussex College: Special Collections.

monogr.title: A descriptive catalogue of the manuscripts in the library of Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge
